Hi guys, I have a problem in setting up my ubuntu laptop with an external LG monitor using an HDMI cable. The audio playing through the monitor is high pitched and faster than usual. I know it is a software problem because i have dual boot on my laptop and on Windows the same cable/same monitor works just fine. I read that it is a problem in Ubuntu (I am on 14.04) because of difference in sampling rates, I tried some stuff but didn't work out. Anyone had this problem before?

as a quick and dirty hack, does unmounting a drive (or removing its drive letter) will protect its content from current ransomeware ?

i know it is not that hard for a program to search for a physical drive and access its content but is this a known behavior for current ransomwares ?
